info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued June 22 at 3:47AM CDT until June 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values 116 to 121 expected. * WHERE...Hidalgo, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, and Inland Willacy Counties. * WHEN...From noon today to 7 PM CDT this evening. Peak heat index is expected from 4 to 7 PM today. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Heat Advisory has been upgraded to an Excessive Heat Warning for the expectation of 2 to 4 hours of heat index 116 or higher. The cumulative effect of very hot and humid days with sultry nights where heat index fails to fall below 90 degrees compounds the impact of the heat on vulnerable populations who may not have access to cooler locations. Heat illness can be worsened by this effect, so at-risk people are urged to seek relatives or cooling centers with air conditioning overnight.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. At risk persons are urged to seek relatives or cooling centers or similar until further notice. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
